minesweeper

Class RandPlace

  • java.lang.Object
    • minesweeper.RandPlace

  • public class RandPlace
extends Object
    RandPlace- looks convoluted; is solely for deciding where bombs are- randomly placing them, if you will
    Author:
    Kevin Khaghani // 1907024@wpsstudent.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandPlace

        public RandPlace(int r,
                 int c,
                 int number)
        This whole class is to create a boolean array
        Parameters:
        r, - rows of the array
        c, - columns of the array
        number; - for Minesweeper this is the number of mines to be placed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if numTrue is ever be greater than (row * col)

    • Method Detail

      • numContains

        public int numContains(boolean truth,
                       boolean[] array)
        numContains counts the number of "true" or "false" (truth) in an array
        Parameters:
        truth, - a boolean state, "true" or "false"
        array, - any boolean[] array
        Returns:
        the number of times truth appears in the array

        public boolean[] valid()
        Bread and butter of the class: creates a valid array (one long one) of [row*col] length, with [numTrue] "true" values
